column4: Is it possible to install 10.04 without losing the contents of the hard drive?
It will replace applications on your harddrive....  So, what are you looking to do?
Keeping /home, /etc, and /usr/local
Shouldn't touch /home or /usr/local....
/etc may be modified depending on the application...  It will not remove items that are not part of the applicaton...  And will usually prompt about changed files....
The partitioning instructions only have 2 partitions. A really big one (the whole disk) and a swap partition.
It seems as though the only option is to reformat the whole big partition.
Are you installing from the CD?
That will blow out the whole hard drive.....
That's what I figured...
Just insert the CD from within Ubuntu....
Let ubuntu do the update.....
Ooo...that sounds just fine!
Ubuntu is *smart* that way....
Or use Synaptic/Update manager and let it do the right thing.....
what command do I give it?  I'm on a CLI.
Then use "aptitude update" and "aptitude upgrade"
apt-get is different than aptitude....
Fix the keys for apt.....
aptitude fails at the same place.  Where do I get the keys?
Here is a whole website that describes everything needed....  http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/upgrade
Sounds fine.  I'll go there.
Sounds good...
